Merge pull request #45 from Onejjy/master

Bugfixes and a new feature

PSSVContainerView transparentView bugfix

Sometimes, PSSVContainerView transparentView frame is not right (it do
not take the full ContainerView bounds). Fixed.

Container height bugfix

Sometimes, PSStackedViewController do not set the good height to a
pushed viewController … Fixed.

Adding enablePopOverlapedViewOnTap feature

Adding enablePopOverlapedViewOnTap to PSStackedViewController.

When true, overlaped views (with overlap ratio under
kPSSVOverlapMinimalValueToApplyDarkRatio) do not accept touches from
user. But, when view is tapped (via UITapGestureRecognizer), the stack
is poped to this viewController.

Merge pull request #7 from vickeryj/master

Fix block based crashes when deallocating an instance of PSStackedViewController.

When alignStackAnimated:NO is called instead of running an animation block with a zero duration, skip the animation block entirely. This is important as alignStackAnimated gets called indirectly when a PSStackedViewController is deallocated which will result in blocks being evaluated after deallocation, which means crashes on self references.

When animation is disabled, don't remove lastController from the iVar list of viewControllers_ before finishBlock is instantiated, otherwise lastController will be deallocated, and finishBlock will hold a reference to a deallocated object at the time that it is instantiated.

Revert "Added style markers"

Removed previousViewController assertion

previousViewController threw an exception on a null viewController parameter.  Which is normally fine, except when dealing with the stacked menu.  It would throw this exception any time a drag gesture was sensed.  To resolve, I have it check for nil and then return, rather than throw.

Black Glyphish menu item images look bad on dark backgrounds.  Normally, an app might want to ship pre-inverted image files, but a method to invert black images seems appropriate during the development stage, to speed up the creative process.

- Pops all view controllers when selecting a new main menu item (when appropriate).
- Added ability to enable/disable main menu cells, with an error image.
- Added some new images for future retina capable displays
Fixed some minor drawing and scrolling issues when pushing view controllers.
